channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Experts warn about the 'crumbling infrastructure' of federal government data
item.description: Unstable federal funding puts at risk the government statistics used to track the U.S. economy and population, officials and data users warn. That's b...

item.title: The U.S. is trying to unravel a hacking plot that targeted climate activists
item.description: The U.S. claims the hacking was commissioned by a lobbying firm working on behalf of one of the world's biggest oil companies.

item.title: 'Hot garbage': Australians react to smell of 'corpse flower' in bloom
item.description: Almost 20,000 people visited Sydney's Botanic Gardens to catch a whiff of a rare plant in bloom.

item.title: Storm Éowyn slams Ireland, parts of U.K. with record winds
item.description: Met Éireann, the Republic of Ireland's national meteorological service, said that the country had faced wind gusts of 114mph in County Galway– the hig...

item.title: Trump targets California water policy as he prepares to tour LA fire damage
Ukraine claims drone strike on Russian oil refinery
item.description: Russia says it shot down more than 120 drones overnight, in what would be one of the largest attacks of the war.

item.title: Trained dogs working inside hospitals help ease burnout among health care staff
item.description: Some hospitals are bringing in dogs to spend entire shifts with doctors and nurses. The trained canines help staff cope with the stress of their work ...

item.title: Hundreds of "illegal immigrant criminals" arrested, White House says
item.description: Hundreds of "illegal immigrant criminals" in the U.S. were arrested and hundreds more flown out of the country on military aircraft as President Trump...

item.title: Trump will visit disaster zones in North Carolina and California on the first trip of second term
item.description: President Donald Trump is heading to hurricane-battered western North Carolina and wildfire-ravaged Los Angeles. It’s the first trip of his second ter...

item.title: Trump is rolling back a Civil Rights-era anti-discrimination rule
item.description: President Trump revoked a 1965 rule that prohibited federal contractors from discriminating against employees.

item.title: UFO is moving at incredible speeds underwater, congressman says
item.description: Republican Rep. Tim Burchett said that an admiral told him of an unidentified craft moving at incredible speeds in the sea.

item.title: 'Ugh. Do I have to?' Honest questions about cardio, illustrated
item.description: If you're in the camp of folks who are dragging their feet to start working out again, this comic is for you.

item.title: What to know about the ruling blocking Trump’s order on birthright citizenship
What did Donald Trump throw to his inauguration crowd? Find out in the news quiz
item.description: Plus: Who got Oscar nods? What's Prince Harry up to? Who's watching Elon Musk? Is Barron Trump a cryptobro?

item.title: Killing of 2 young brothers triggers outrage in cartel bastion
item.description: Thousands of protesters took to the streets, demanding justice for two boys shot and killed in a city shaken by Sinaloa cartel infighting.

item.title: New fires erupt in southern California ahead of Trump visit
item.description: The blazes - named Laguna, Sepulveda, Gibbel, Gilman and Border 2 - flared up on Thursday in Los Angeles, San Diego, Ventura and Riverside.

item.title: Man jailed for 30 years for Charlie Hebdo meat cleaver attack
item.description: Zaheer Mahmood, from Pakistan, seriously injured two people outside magazine's former offices after republication of Muhammad cartoons.

item.title: Hamas to name next Israeli hostages set to be released
item.description: Four are due to be freed in a second exchange of hostages for Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.
